detaileddescription.para: Compute the width and height required to view the text on the screen.

parameterdescription.para: The width required is set here, if notNULL.
The height required is set here, if notNULL.

detaileddescription.para: Get the onscreen width of a string, or a substring.

parameterdescription.para: The end of the string. The width returned is the width upto (but not including) end. If end is NULL, then start is considered as a NULL-terminated string.

simplesect.para: The on-screen width of the string.

detaileddescription.para: Computes and returns the string after a specific number of onscreen characters.

parameterdescription.para: The length to consider. If non-positive, the entire screenlength is used.
The actual width of the string upto the returned offset, if not NULL.

detaileddescription.para: Inserts newlines in 'string' where necessary so that its onscreen width is no more than 'maxw'.

parameterdescription.para: The width that the string should fit into. If maxw is <= 0, then the available maximum width is used.

simplesect.para: A newly allocated string that needs to be freed by the caller.

memberdef.argsstring: (GHashTable *src, GHashFunc hash, GEqualFunc equal, GDestroyNotify key_d, GDestroyNotify value_d, GDupFunc key_dup, GDupFunc value_dup)
memberdef.name: g_hash_table_duplicate

detaileddescription.para: Duplicate the contents of a hastable.

parameterdescription.para: The function to use to duplicate the key.
The function to use to duplicate the value.

detaileddescription.para: To be used with g_signal_new. Look in the key_pressed signal-definition in gntwidget.c for usage.
Get a helpful display about the bindings of a widget.

parameterdescription.para: The widget to get bindings for.

simplesect.para: Returns a GntTree populated with "key" -> "binding" for the widget.

detaileddescription.para: Parse widgets from an XML description. For example,

parameterdescription.para: The number of widgets to return, followed by 'num' GntWidget **

detaileddescription.para: Parse an XHTML string and add it in a GntTextView with appropriate text flags.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the string was added to the textview properly, FALSE otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Make some keypress activate a button when some key is pressed with 'wid' in focus.

parameterdescription.para: The key to trigger the button
